# Pull Request

## Description

Please include a summary of the changes and the related issue. Please also include relevant motivation and context.

Fixes # (issue)

## Type of Change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Code refactoring
- [ ] Test improvements

## Framework Support

Which frameworks are affected by this change?

- [ ] React
- [ ] Vue
- [ ] Angular
- [ ] Svelte
- [ ] Solid
- [ ] Lit
- [ ] Preact
- [ ] Vanilla
- [ ] Framework agnostic
- [ ] CLI/Core functionality

## Testing

Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes. Provide instructions so we can reproduce.

- [ ] Unit tests pass
- [ ] Integration tests pass
- [ ] Manual testing completed
- [ ] Performance testing (if applicable)

- Node.js version:
- Operating System:
- Framework versions tested:

## Checklist

Please check all that apply:

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules

## Breaking Changes

If this is a breaking change, please describe:

1. What functionality is breaking
2. What the migration path is for existing users
3. Why this breaking change is necessary

## Performance Impact

If applicable, describe the performance impact of your changes:

- [ ] Performance improvement (include benchmarks)
- [ ] No performance impact
- [ ] Potential performance regression (explain mitigation)

Any additional information, configuration changes, or considerations for reviewers.

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your changes.
